I've been trying to modify the config.ini (I'm trying to install Eclipse in a
common environment for multiple users), but to no avail.

I'm pretty sure I'm missing something obvious, so please forgive me.

What I know is that Eclipse looks for the properties file in:

/usr/local/eclipse-3.0.0/plugins/org.eclipse.osgi/eclipse.properties

But in fact it is in:

/usr/local/eclipse-3.0.0/plugins/org.eclipse.osgi_3.0.0/eclipse.properties

Thanks in advance.

Didier

Created an attachment (id=14521)
Current config.ini

Forgot to include my current config.ini.

Comment the osgi.framework property in the beginning of the file.
Note that 
  osgi.install.area=file:/usr/local/Eclipse
  osgi.configuration.area=@user.home
are not necessary either, since you will likely make the shared install read 
only.
  osgi.user.area is not required either

The only thing you should do is run eclipse with -initialize once.
Be careful to not create any workspace.
